group_1.narration: I learned firsthand how@important it is to have proof.
People don't tend to believe things they@can't see for themselves.
I'd learned that in theory, but...it was@much harder to do in practice.

group_1.textCenter: (My parents bought me a camera!)
(I can even take it to school. The rules@aren't strict about it.)
(Everyone will finally stop calling me@"Tall Tales Midori"!)
(I'll make sure I get my hands on the perfect@piece of proof!)

group_1.narration: *Skid*

group_1.textCenter: Whoa!
(That was close! That car was going way too@fast.)
Oh no!!!
(She's right in its way!)

group_1.narration: By the time I realized, it was already too@late.
[bgEffect:shakeLarge]*THUD*

group_1.textCenter: (Sh-she got hit by the car... [wait:0.8][chara:304601:cheek_1][chara:304601:face_mtn_ex_030.exp.json]What do I do?!)
(What do you do at a time like this?!)
(Um, let's see, uhhh... The police? Wait,@maybe an ambulance? No, I should help...)

group_1.narration: *Vrooom*

group_1.textCenter: Huh?
(The car sped off. What's going on?)

group_1.narration: I'd only just realized how important@it was to have proof. But right then...@All I could do was watch, dumbfounded,@as the car sped away. I couldn't do a thing.
Forget using the camera my@parents had just bought for me...@I couldn't even remember the license plate.

group_1.textRight: You don't remember the license plate?

group_1.textLeft: No, I don't...

group_1.textRight: Do you remember what kind of car it was?

group_1.textLeft: U-um...

group_1.textRight: Anything you can remember will help. The@color, or general shape...

group_1.textLeft: It was...black? [chara:304601:lipSynch_0][wait:0.8][chara:304601:eyeClose_1][chara:304601:lipSynch_1]I think it was a@normal size. Sorry, that's all I remember...

group_1.textRight: I see... Don't push yourself, now.
I'll give you my business card. If you do@remember anything, please call us.

group_1.textLeft: ...[wait:0.8][chara:304601:lipSynch_1]I will.

group_1.textRight: Don't worry, you've done nothing wrong.
The victim got to the hospital just in time,@because you called that ambulance.
Your mom should be here soon.
You just wait here, okay?
You must not blame yourself.
We'll investigate this as best we can so we@can catch the culprit. Don't worry.

group_1.narration: The kinder they were, the more it hurt.@I'll never forget how awful it felt.
I was the one who stood there helpless.@I was the reason they had no evidence.
I felt responsible for it.

group_1.textCenter: (This is worse than being called a liar.)
(The camera didn't help at all.)

group_1.textRight: How are things at the crime scene?

group_1.textLeft: They're still looking for decisive evidence,@so it's hard to say...
How about our witness?

group_1.textRight: Looks like she doesn't remember much. She@seems to be in shock.

group_1.textLeft: This is going to be difficult. We don't have@any other witnesses.

group_1.narration: No one else was around when it happened.@I was the sole witness to the accident.
And yet...@I couldn't do a thing.
That regret directly inspired my wish,@when the time came.

group_1.textCenter: (They said they'd contact me if they found@the criminal.)
(They haven't called since then, though...)
(I guess they have no other leads.)
(It's all because I couldn't remember the@number on the license plate.)
(I let the proof slip through my fingers!)

group_1.textRight: Ryo, I'm stepping out to buy some groceries.

group_1.textLeft: Okay.

group_1.textRight: Will you be okay on your own?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah. I'm fine.

group_1.textRight: If you say so... I'll be back soon!

group_1.textLeft: All right. Watch out for traffic.

group_1.narration: Ever since the hit-and-run incident, I'd@been wallowing in a deep depression.@That's when he showed up...

group_1.textCenter: Greetings, Ryo Midori. My name is Kyubey.

group_1.narration: Yeah. That guy.
I know this now, because I know all@about the truth behind Magical Girls,@but right then, I was perfect prey for him.
I was in a place where I absolutely couldn't@forgive myself for what I failed to do.
Unable to work out how to deal with@the guilt, I was relentless with myself.

group_1.textLeft: So if I become a Magical Girl, I can get@whatever wish I like granted?

group_1.textRight: I wouldn't say "whatever" wish, but I can@certainly manage most wishes.

group_1.textLeft: The hit-and-run driver.
If I wished for you to catch the hit-and-run@driver, would they get caught?

group_1.textRight: It's possible. Which driver do you mean?

group_1.textLeft: Sorry?

group_1.textRight: Hit-and-run accidents occur so often all@across the globe, every day.
Which hit-and-run driver would you like to@catch?

group_1.textLeft: (Right... I hadn't thought of it like that.)
(Crimes happen every day.)
You only get one wish, is that right?

group_1.textRight: Of course.

group_1.textLeft: Then forget what I just said.
(I need to think it over...)
(If something like that hit-and-run incident@ever happens again...)
(I don't want to regret it like I am now.)
(It felt so awful, being unable to do@anything to stop it...)
(Being right there at the scene of the crime@but unable to grab any evidence.)
(I even had a camera right there in my hands,@but I didn't take a picture...)
I think I've got it.
I never want to miss the perfect picture.
That's my wish.

group_1.narration: And that's how I became a Magical Girl.

group_1.textCenter: I've been getting stuck in weird situations@for as long as I can remember, I swear.
